alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Lamar; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 05 at 11:27AM CDT until April 05 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR MARION, FORREST AND LAMAR COUNTIES... At 1127 AM CDT, Rain continues to move across the warned area and flash flooding continues. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen, and additional rainfall of up to one inch is possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hattiesburg, Petal, Columbia, West Hattiesburg, Sandy Hook, Kokomo, Holly Springs, Purvis, Lumberton, Sumrall, Pine Ridge, Baxterville, Oak Grove, Pinebur, Improve, Rawls Springs, Rock Hill, Pickwick, Bunker Hill and Mclaurin. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
